intro: Chichaea acerifolia, commonly known as the flame tree, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a dramatic visual impact. The plant has compound leaves composed of several elongated, pointed leaflets. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Chichaea acerifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display.
